page.title: 13St.John's/St.Pat's School
page.content: The site of the old St.John's Church of England School is a short distance from the present school. The new school was opened on 29th.June 1971 by Ina Ramsay,the then Bishop of Durham.A neighbouring Roman Catholic school had only 29 pupils so it was decided to merge the two schools.This made{the first ecumenical school in {England. The school was reopened as St.John's and St.Patrick's by John Hapgood,who was Bishop of Durham,but is now Bishop of York and the Rt.Rev.Owen Swindlehurst R.C. Bishop of Chester le Street. The Headteacher at the time of the merger was Mr.J.E.Knight.
